sense.name: deliberate stoppage of an activity, especially work
sense.examples: The trains were on strike for six hours in Italy yesterday. The prisoners organized a hunger strike. The mechanics received strike pay from the union. Can the tenants be evicted for going on a rent strike?

sense.name: a sudden attack
sense.examples: They ordered a pre-emptive strike on the terrorist stronghold. A surgical strike was conducted against selected military targets, using smart bombs. The government is trying to prevent another terrorist strike at home.

sense.name: a valid baseball pitch that is missed
sense.commentary: STRIKE[+action][+pitch][+baseball][+valid][+missed] [+state][+disadvantage][+handicap] Note: it is a handicap or black mark, because as the strikes accrue, the batter is in trouble. Note: The above handicap situation is the source of the metaphoric extension of this sense.
sense.examples: The count on the batter is now two balls and two strikes. That fast ball went right over the inside corner of the strike zone. California has a DWI policy of three strikes and you're out. (metaphoric extension) These kids already have two strikes against them by the time they reach high school. (metaphoric extension, a disadvantage) Bob's age was a strike against him when applying to medical school in his thirties. (metaphoric extension, a disadvantage)

sense.name: a physical blow
sense.examples: The coroner determined that the cause of death was a strike to the head with a tire iron. These small cuts on her leg look like the strike marks of a rattlesnake.

sense.name: discovery of ore deposits, e.g., gold, oil
sense.examples: We read about the Lena gold field strike of 1912. Their family became wealthy from several oil strikes on their land.

sense.name: a success, good fortune
sense.examples: Being the understudy for a famous tenor was John's lucky strike in opera. Her strike in Las Vegas at blackjack came to over ten thousand dollars.

sense.name: knocking all the pins down in one bowling shot
sense.examples: That's John's third strike in a row, while I keep making gutter balls! For a strike in bowling, try to aim the ball between the front pin and the one to its right.

sense.name: the orientation of a geological stratum
sense.commentary: STRIKE[+location][+orientation][+stratum][+geological] Note: does not imply discovery of valuable ore deposit, different from Sense 5
sense.examples: The geology students had to measure the strike of this layer of sedimentary rock. The geologist determined the strike of the coal seam was 15 degrees north of due west.

sense.name: the tightening of a fishing line
sense.examples: The fisherman suddenly felt a strike on his fishing rod. (a fish may be pulling on it) Had any strikes today on the lines off your boat?

sense.name: establishment of roots and plant growth
sense.examples: We need to clear out the strike of weeds around the back of the house. Gradually a strike of ground cover began to re-emerge over the burned land.

sense.name: an infestation of fly larvae under the skin
sense.examples: The farmer noticed a strike on several sheep in his herd. The veterinarian says a new species of fly is responsible for the recent strike on livestock.
